sec.title: Instructions to contributors
sec.p: IET Power Electronics is published 12 times a year by the Institution of Engineering and Technology. All papers are subject to rigorous peer review and the decision to publish is based on the reviewers' comments. Papers should include a comprehensive, up-to-date literature review and the experimental results presented should demonstrate a significant advance over the current state of the art.

sec.title: Aims and scope
sec.p: IET Power Electronics aims to attract original research papers, short communications, review articles and power electronics related educational studies. The scope covers applications and technologies in the field of power electronics with special focus on cost-effective, efficient, power dense, environmentally friendly and robust solutions, which includes:

sec.title: Applications:
sec.p: Electric drives/generators, renewable energy, industrial and consumable applications (including lighting, welding, heating, sub-sea applications, drilling and others), medical and military apparatus, utility applications, transport and space application, energy harvesting, telecommunications, energy storage management systems, home appliances.

sec.title: Technologies:
sec.p: Circuits: All type of converter topologies for low and high power applications including but not limited to: inverter, rectifier, dc/dc converter, power supplies, UPS, ac/ac converter, resonant converter, high frequency converter, hybrid converter, multilevel converter, power factor correction circuits and other advanced topologies.

Components and Materials: Switching devices and their control, inductors, sensors, transformers, capacitors, resistors, thermal management, filters, fuses and protection elements and other novel low-cost efficient components/materials
Control: Techniques for controlling, analysing, modelling and/or simulation of power electronics circuits and complete power electronics systems.
Design/Manufacturing/Testing: New multi-domain modelling, assembling and packaging technologies, advanced testing techniques.

Environmental Impact: Electromagnetic interference (EMI) reduction techniques, electromagnetic compatibility (EMC), limiting acoustic noise and vibration, recycling techniques, use of non-rare material.
Education: Teaching methods, programme and course design, use of technology in power electronics teaching, virtual laboratory and elearning and fields within the scope of interest.

sec.title: Manuscript submission
sec.p: All submissions to IET Power Electronics must be uploaded via our online submission system at: http://mc.manuscriptcentral.com/iet-pel Hard copy submissions cannot be accepted. Original papers should be submitted as a single file that includes all figures and tables. Upon submission of your revised paper you will be asked to include all source files ready for production. If the paper is intended for a specific Special Issue, please make this clear when uploading your paper.

Submitted papers should follow the guidelines outlined in our Author Guide: http://digital-library.theiet.org/journals/author-guide. This includes adhering to our IET Research Journal's length policy found here: http://digital-library.theiet.org/files/research_journals_length_policy.pdf. If a paper does not meet all of the requirements it will be unsubmitted, before review, and changes will be required.

sec.title: Subscription Information and Pricing
sec.p: To find out how to subscribe to IET Power Electronics or to see current pricing, please visit: www.ietdl.org/catalogue or contact us: sales@theiet.org.

sec.title: IET Digital Library
sec.p: IET Research Journals are available online through the IET Digital Library. Features include: "e-first" article publishing; browsable table of contents for all IET publications; cross-journal searching of bibliographic records (by title, keyword, issue date and author name); links to related and cited articles COUNTER-compliant usage statistics; table of contents alerting service, pay-per-view and document delivery. For further details, please visit http://www.ietdl.org
